{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3305201,"name":"","username":"sciln24","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/6f9a4e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-08T22:37:51.931Z","cooked":"

Hello.

My team is working with path planner for autonomous runs this year and have encountered a problem where the point on the robot which path planner perceives as the front of the robot is actually 90 degrees off of the actual front of the robot. This causes the robot to move sideways rather than forwards.

I don’t think that this is an issue with our gyro as when controlling the robot in teleoperated mode, the robot is still able function correctly. Does anyone have an idea on how to fix this problem?

Thanks

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-02-08T22:37:51.931Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":115,"reads":180,"readers_count":179,"score":611.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":453964,"topic_slug":"front-of-robot-is-90-degrees-off-in-path-planner","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56900,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/front-of-robot-is-90-degrees-off-in-path-planner/453964/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3305299,"name":"neev dadhania","username":"nevadexehs","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ecc23a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-09T01:19:02.116Z","cooked":"

i think you are misinterpreting the dot of the square on the robot pose.

this is a robot pose:

the brighter red circle in the middle is the center of the robot, while the darker point to the right, along the perimeter, is 0 degrees (as in unit circle).

image1280×720 59.6 KB

this corresponds to your robot gyro, which in the case of a ctre pigeon, follows the diagram printed on the case:

image1171×1280 229 KB

0 degrees will be on positive x, 90 degrees on positive y, 180 degrees on negative x, 270 or -90 degrees will be negative y

hope this helps!

There was Just a thread on this topic a day or three ago… I’ll take a look. Search generally works pretty well.

Edit:
Not the one I was thinking about, but still hopefully worth a look:

Robot turns 90 degrees in autonomous even though the pathweaver path starts straight Programming
Our robot turns 90 degrees in autonomous before starting the path we specify. It’s really weird, i’ve never encountered this before. In pathweaver, our path starts pointing towards the grid and is just supposed to reverse onto the charging station. Here is our code: Elliot Scher / 2815 Robot 2023 · GitLab If anyone can help that would be great!!

We had a very similar issue in our off season. We found that our cancoders had been set so their zero was pointing in the wrong direction, and once we recalibrated them to the correct direction, pathplanner went straight when we expected it to
